FuncDef:
The map-rule command binds a basic mapping rule (BMR) to a MAP instance.
The undo map-rule command deletes the binding between a BMR and a MAP instance.
By default, no BMR is bound to a MAP instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a BMR name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the MAP-T or MAP-E function is configured, run the map rule command to bind a BMR to a MAP instance so that the BMR takes effect.
Precautions
A maximum of 256 BMRs can be bound to each MAP instance.A BMR can only be bound to a single MAP instance.
